description: tele- +‎ vision; first attested in 1900, probably influenced by French télévision from Constantin Perskyi's 1900 paper that was unpublished but presented at a Paris conference.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) An electronic communication medium that allows the transmission of real-time visual images, and often sound.
examples: It's a good thing that television doesn't transmit smell.

entries.meaning: (countable) A device for receiving television signals and displaying them in visual form.
examples: I have an old television in the study.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Collectively, the programs broadcast via the medium of television.
examples: fifty-seven channels and nothing on television
[…]  the magic mirror  […]  which furnished him television of his family and country

verbs.description: television (third-person singular simple present televisions, present participle televisioning, simple past and past participle televisioned)
